description: This course examines how music and poetry are intertwined with significant American political and cultural movements of the twentieth century and today. It concentrates on the lives and work of the poets and musicians who contributed to the Civil Rights Movement and later ones, including the WomenÂ’s Liberation and Anti-War Movements. Students will encounter poets and musicians like Langston Hughes, Billie Holiday, Bob Dylan, and Nina Simone. Prerequisite: WRIT 120 or equivalent.
